description:
Who We Are

Motive empowers the people who run physical operations with tools to make their work safer, more productive, and more profitable. For the first time ever, safety, operations and finance teams can manage their drivers, vehicles, equipment, and fleet related spend in a single system. Combined with industry leading AI, the Motive platform gives you complete visibility and control, and significantly reduces manual workloads by automating and simplifying tasks.

Motive serves more than 120,000 customers – from Fortune 500 enterprises to small businesses – across a wide range of industries, including transportation and logistics, construction, energy, field service, manufacturing, agriculture, food and beverage, retail, and the public sector.

Visit gomotive.com to learn more.

About The Role

The Director, Strategic Partnerships will play a key role in setting and executing strategy for a key set of strategic partners at Motive. They will be responsible for identifying and recruiting high-value partnerships with Independent Software Vendors, Systems Integrators, and Resellers strongly correlated with driving our Enterprise segment growth. This role will require a strong understanding of building and launching new partner programs beginning with internal cross-functional alignment, partner recruitment, internal enablement, and ongoing partner success. It will also require leadership and management expertise as it will grow into a role including direct reports.

What You’ll Do
• Craft a business plan that outlines the ideal end state of partners, partner types, and partner programs needed for Motive to move across industries and into larger enterprise customers, along with the investments required to make it a reality
• Formulate and launch an ongoing cross-functional internal process to build a business case to evaluate, prioritize, and launch the most impactful partnerships across ISVs, SIs, and Resellers including inept from key cross-functional stakeholders
• Design, launch, and manage a highly-valuable partner program aimed at enticing 3rd Party ISVs to build to our APIs
• Launch a self-service program designed to help interested integration partners build and list their integrations on our marketplace in a cost efficient manner
• Work closely with Product to ensure we maintain an integrated approach on the Build/Buy/Partner decisions
• Create and launch an internal enablement program designed to ensure 100% of Motive’s GTM teams understand what integrations are currently available, what to do when one isn’t available, and continually gather data to inform future decisions on which integrations should be prioritized
• Drive the creation and execution of a reporting strategy designed to measure the impact of ISV, SI, and Reseller partners
• Develop and maintain project plans, timelines, and budgets for partnerships initiatives
• Manage stakeholder relationships, including working closely with partners, cross-functional teams, and internal stakeholders
• Analyze and evaluate the success of partnerships initiatives and develop recommendations for improvements
• Identify and assess potential risks and challenges, and develop mitigation plans
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of partnerships initiatives with company-wide initiatives and goals
• Ensure that all partnerships initiatives are executed in compliance with company policies and legal requirements
• Ability to communicate effectively at all organizational levels and in situations requiring instructing, persuading, negotiating, conflict resolution, consulting, and advising, as well as flawless written communication

What We’re Looking For
• Have a minimum of 5-7 years working extensively with ISVs
• Understand and effectively prioritize the top integration needs for Motive
• Measure and track the impact of ISV, SI, and Reseller partners on Motives overall business
• Launch end-to-end process for the identification, recruitment, launch, and success of ISV, SI, and Reseller partners
• Design a long-term monetization strategy of the relevant partners this role has responsibility for managing

Pay Transparency

Your compensation may be based on several factors, including education, work experience, and certifications. For certain roles, total compensation may include restricted stock units. Motive offers benefits including health, pharmacy, optical and dental care benefits, paid time off, sick time off, short term and long term disability coverage, life insurance as well as 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Learn more about our benefits by visiting Motive Perks & Benefits.

The compensation range for this position will depend on where you reside. For this role, the compensation range is:

United States

$171,000—$240,000 USD

Creating a diverse and inclusive workplace is one of Motive's core values. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives.

Please review our Candidate Privacy Notice here.

The applicant must be authorized to receive and access those commodities and technologies controlled under U.S. Export Administration Regulations. It is Motive's policy to require that employees be authorized to receive access to Motive products and technology.
